X.T: Science étonnante
Pourquoi Comment Combien
Inclass@blεs Mathématiqu€s
Choux romanesco, Vache qui rit et intégrales curvilignes
Le Manuscrit Einstein-Besso

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Etienne Klein
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Etienne Klein quickly summarizes Einstein's work and answers to some questions on the current status of physics.

X.T: A Practical T-Ray Amplifier
X.ST: Terahertz sensors can see through clothing and sniff for bombs, but they've had to do so with very weak signals

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Saswato R. Das
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some progress in terahertz radiation (aka "T-rays") sensors.

X.T: Emmy Noether and The Fabric of Reality

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ransom Stephens
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Emmy Noether's life and theorem ("If a system has a continuous symmetry property, then there are corresponding quantities whose values are conserved in time.").

X.T: The Origin of the Universe and the Arrow of Time

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sean Carroll
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After reminding the second law of thermodynamics, Sean Carroll presents his multiverse theory.

X.T: Les Battements du temps - Marc Lachièze-Rey & Jean Claude Ameisen

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marc Lachièze-Rey
Jean Claude Ameisen
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of what time and causality are in the Newtonian theory and in the theory of relativity.

X.T: Histoire de l'électricité : des pierres précieuses aux supraconducteurs

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jacques Lewiner
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Miscellaneous facts about electricity.

X.T: Les supraconducteurs et leurs fascinantes propriétés

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Julien Bobroff
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The history of superconductivity, the explanations are too much popularised, but the experiments are spectacular.

X.T: La physique buissonnière

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jean-Michel Courty
Edouard Kierlik
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The explanation of the water superheating effect in a microwave oven.

X.T: Pentaquark - Sixty Symbols

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Tony Padilla
ARTICLE.COMMENT: LHC announced the (re)discovery of pentaquarks.

X.T: Coffee Mechanics - Sixty Symbols

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Philip Moriarty
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Waves in a quantum corral and a cup of coffee are the same: Bessels functions.

X.T: À la lumière du Laser

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marc Brunel
Marc Vallet
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some basic facts about laser.

X.T: L’effet Casimir…et le retour de 1+2+3+4+5+…=-1/12 !

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Louapre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of the Casimir effect and its computation.

X.T: L'antimatière existe : je l'ai rencontrée

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Catherine Thibault
ARTICLE.COMMENT: What is antimatter? How it has been discover? Dissymmetry with matter…

X.T: Why Physicists Need the Large Hadron Collider

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Edward Farhi
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Edward Farhi does not really talk about the LHC, this discussion is more about particle physics in general.

X.T: Richard Dawkins: Why the universe seems so strange
Richard Dawkins: Why the universe seems so strange

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Richard Dawkins
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Things such as quantum physics seem strange to us because our brain is good at what is useful for monkey's life and atom nucleuses are not part of this life.

X.T: Leonard Susskind: My friend Richard Feynman
Leonard Susskind: My friend Richard Feynman

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Leonard Susskind
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Susskind tells stories about his friend Feynman.

X.T: Is the Higgs Boson there? Why do we care?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Edward Farhi
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A casual talk on LHC and particles, Edward Farhi does give more information than in his other talks.

X.T: John Preskill: Quantum Computing and the Entanglement Frontier

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: John Preskill
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to build a quantum computer and how to deal with quantum entanglement.

X.T: L'étrangeté quantique mise en lumière

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Alain Aspect
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The wave-particle duality and interference of a single photon with itself.

X.T: Physics shocker! Neutrinos clocked faster than light

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Stephen Shankland
ARTICLE.COMMENT: During the OPERA experiment, researchers computed a speed of neutrinos greater than the speed of light.

X.T: The Data That Threatened to Break Physics
X.ST: What does a rational scientist do with an impossible result

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ransom Stephens
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A detailed story of the error, the media sensationalism, the finding of the root cause, and the aftermath.

X.T: Les ondes gravitationnelles — À chaud ! #1

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Louapre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information on gravitational waves and the LIGO experiment.

X.T: Les ondes gravitationnelles

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Louapre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A postscript to the previous video.

X.T: Morphogénèses chimiques : les réactions créatrices de rythmes et de formes

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Patrick De Kepper
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of chemical reactions generating temporal and/or spatial structures.

X.T: De la Matière à la Vie : Chimie ? Chimie !

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jean-Marie Lehn
ARTICLE.COMMENT: From the beginning of the understand of chemistry to inventing self-assembling molecules.

X.T: Alán Aspuru-Guzik: "Billions and Billions of Molecules"

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Alán Aspuru-Guzik
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using machine learning to accelerate molecule discovery.

X.ST: These infinitesimal celebrities shape us and our world.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Patchen Barss
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Beta-ionone, ethanol, oxytocin, draculin, polyethylene , methanethiol, and sulfuric acid.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Richard Saykally
ARTICLE.COMMENT: There are still some unknowns about water.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Henry Reich
ARTICLE.COMMENT: There is no evaporation, but a the chemical reaction between cement and water

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Martyn Poliakoff
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Elements 113, 115, 117 and 118 have been recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. What will be their names?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Martyn Poliakoff
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The names for elements 113, 115, 117 and 118 have been proposed: Nihonium (Nh), Moscovium (Mc), Tennessine (Ts) and Oganesson (Og).

X.T: Apollo XI : résumé couleur de la mission sur la Lune

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A summary of the Apollo XI mission.

X.T: Our Place in the Cosmos

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Raja (Puragra) GuhaThakurta
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The explained physics is very basic, but the pictures and videos are interesting.

X.T: The Remote Agent Experiment: Debugging Code from 60 Million Miles Away

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ron Garret
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the RAX project and some opinion about the evolution of NASA.

X.T: The Second Copernican Revolution: Our Changing View of Our Place in the Universe

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: John L. Callas
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Life could be somewhere else in the universe: hundred of exoplanets have been found; Enceladus and Europa contains liquid water; Mars exploration proves that the planet had some liquid water.

X.T: Mars Exploration Driven by Curiosity

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael A. Meyer
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the Mars rover, its arrival on Mars, its route on the planet, and its first discoveries.

X.T: Matt Deans: The Exploration Ground Data System (xGDS)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Matt Deans
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the software tools used for mapping, planning the road and experiments of a robot, logging notes from the scientists…

X.T: Orbital Debris: Time to Remove

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Eugene Levin
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The problem of the orbital debris and a proposed solution to solve it.

X.T: Voyager 1 Discovers Bizarre and Baffling Region at Edge of Solar System

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Adam Mann
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The measurements sent by Voyager 1, as it is leaving the solar system, are unexpected.

X.T: Conférence de presse du CNES sur Philae

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marc Pircher
Philippe Gaudon
ARTICLE.COMMENT: First news after Philae arrived on Tchouri.

X.T: À la recherche des océans extraterrestres

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Olivier Grasset
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Where could there be some liquid water in the solar system?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Pierre Binétruy

X.T: Les couleurs de l'Univers

X.T: Coded Mask - Sixty Symbols

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael Merrifield
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Presentation of the coded-aperture masks used in X-ray telescopes.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael Merrifield
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The huge binary star η Carinae and its Homunculus Nebula.

X.T: The Millisecond Pulsar in M28 - Deep Sky Videos

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Paul Crowther
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says all.

X.T: The most mysterious star in the universe | Tabetha Boyajian
Tabetha Boyajian: The most mysterious star in the universe

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Tabetha Boyajian
ARTICLE.COMMENT: KIC 8462852's light fluctuations are still explained.

X.T: Spinning Stars and Messier 50 - Deep Sky Videos

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Allen H. Lutins
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is a list of the nuclear accidents in the US.

X.T: The Three Mile Island Accident: Moment By Moment

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Scott Johnson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The narration of the Match 28, 1979 accident. This is a good factual paper, maybe slightly sensationalistic. The consequences of the accident are not tackled.

X.T: Backgrounder on the Three Mile Island Accident

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A fact sheet on the accident: description, health effects and ensuing decisions.

X.T: The NRX Incident

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Peter Jedicke
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is a presentation of the partial meltdown of an experimental nuclear reactor in Canada (1952).

X.T: Chernobyl Ten Years on
X.ST: An Assessment by the NEA Committee on Radiation Protection and Public Health

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This report summarizes the accident events, its impacts on health and environment and the lessons learned.

X.T: CHELYABINSK "The Most Contaminated Spot on the Planet"

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Log In Productions
ARTICLE.COMMENT: These pages contains the materials of a film about the Chelyabinsk region.

X.T: Ozersk

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Nils Boehmer
Thomas Nilsen
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is another article on Chelyabinsk. This one is more technical and speaks less about the human impact than the previous one.

X.T: Arctic Sea Dumping

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hilde Elin Haaland
Chad Cummins
Shehu Ibrahim
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A summary of the USSR dumping of military nuclear waste and their potential impact on Norway.

X.T: Tokaimura (Japan's Sep. 30, 1999) Nuclear Accident: It's Causes, Health & Environmental Effects

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Najmedin Meshkati
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This student work gives some information about JCO's accident.

X.T: Case Study: Sverdlovsk Anthrax Outbreak of 1979

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Alex Neifert
ARTICLE.COMMENT: An anthrax epidemic in USSR: infected meat or a leakage from a military laboratory?

X.T: Where Have the Birds of Guam Gone?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An overview of the brown tree snake invasion on Guam and how these snake are destroying the local life.

X.T: Curing Guam's Snake Epidemic

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Tim Stoddard
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A more detailed description of the Guam disaster: most aspects (attacks of babies, economy impact, virus introduction…) are described.

X.T: Lake Victoria

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marcela Rabi
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A very good overview of the Lake Victoria issues (perch invasion and eutrophication) and all the impacts on animals, humans and economy.

X.T: Craig Venter's Epic Voyage to Redefine the Origin of the Species

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: James Shreeve
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After having decoded the human genome, Venter is now capturing genes of microbes around the world.

X.T: What on earth? Database to list all named species

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Colin Nickerson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Encyclopedia of Life: a tentative to build a database of all species.

X.T: Billion Bag, Bottle, and Bulb Challenge

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Greg Peterson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Nothing new here, maybe because, in Europe, we are more concerned by preserving the environment and we already know all this stuff.

X.T: The World Market for Coal: What's going on the C of "RE less than C"?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Victor
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information on the coal market and the fact that Carbon Capture and Storage efforts are much lower than required.

X.T: Making a Difference: Individuals Taking Local Action on Global Warming

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Julio Magalhães
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the initiatives of the Silicon Valley's Sierra Club Chapter to help reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

X.T: The Liquid Fluoride Thorium Reactor: What Fusion Wanted To Be

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Joe Bonometti
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of a reactor design using thorium. Joe Bonometti explains its advantages compared to the current nuclear plant technologies: simpler, safer, more fuel reserves, faster decay of waste…

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Colin Nickerson

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sandra Upson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Jordan has decided to use "fossil" water instead of desalinated seawater, but this one is contaminated with radium.

X.T: Map: China Rewires Its Rivers

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Anne-Marie Corley
ARTICLE.COMMENT: China is transferring some Yangtze River water to the north of the country.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sally Adee

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The Colorado River cannot provide enough water to all, in particular to the energy (geothermy and coal) plants.

X.T: The Water Cost of Carbon Capture

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Samuel K. Moore
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The current carbon capture technologies are using too much water.

X.T: How to Count ALL Human Carbon Emissions in the US

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Kevin Gurney

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hunter Lovins

The Coming Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era

X.T: Why the future doesn't need us

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Bill Joy
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Bill Joy describes his vision of the risks induced by the new technologies (genetics, nanotechnology and robotics) and how he tries to fight them.

X.T: Why the Future Doesn't Need Us

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Here are the answers from some more or less known persons to Bill Joy's article.

X.T: Bill Joy: What I'm worried about, what I'm excited about
Bill Joy: What I'm worried about, what I'm excited about

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Bill Joy
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Bill Joy is still worried, but he describes here three solutions he is advocating by funding them: cheap computers used for education (but this requires the adequate software), new materials / nano-technologies, pandemic fight and biodefense. His conclusion on restricting information flow is quite doubtful.

X.T: One Half Of A Manifesto

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jaron Lanier
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Jaron tries to demolish the Cybernetic Totalists' arguments about the future technological Armageddon. This is a kind of answer to Vinge's paper.

X.T: Look Who's Talking

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Howard Rheingold
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Rheingold describes how the Amish are handling the new technologies, choosing to accept or not their use on a case by case basis.

X.T: Databases of the Dead

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Erik Davis
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This explains why and how the Mormons are creating the world genealogy database.

X.T: Putting the Fun in Functional: Applying Game Mechanics to Functional Software

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Amy Jo Kim
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to use some attributes of games (collecting, points, feedback, exchanges, and customization) to social websites.

X.T: The Pleasure Revolution: Why Games Will Lead the Way (Jesse Schell)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jesse Shell
ARTICLE.COMMENT: It is not so simple to gamify a product, it is a matter of pleasure: how to make them like more what they already like.

X.T: Crétin de cerveau ! #1 — L'effet de Halo

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Louapre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: One aspect of the halo effect: the physical appearance of a person impacts how we judge some other of her/his characteristics.

X.T: L'effet d'ancrage — Crétin de cerveau #2

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Louapre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Anchoring consists into giving a first piece of information to bias a subsequent judgement.

X.T: Les coûts irrécupérables — Crétin de cerveau #3

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Louapre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Sunk costs are, but they should not, considered when making a new decision.

X.T: The Illusion of Truth

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Derek Muller
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Cognitive ease makes us believe that the more something is repeated, the more it feels true.

X.T: RSA Animate - The Truth About Dishonesty

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Dan Ariely
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Cheating, confession, and bankers.

X.T: RSA Animate - Drive: The surprising truth about what motivates us

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Dan Pink
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says all.

X.T: RSA Animate - The Paradox of Choice

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Renata Salecl
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The negative effects of having too much choices.

X.T: Debunking myths about the "Third World" (Amazing graphics)
Debunking third-world myths with the best stats you've ever seen

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hans Rosling
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using spectacular animated graphics to show that the world is not anymore how we believe it still is. Hans Rosling also explains that the economical data he used should be free for use by all students and professors.

X.T: When Will We Discover the Extraterrestrials?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Seth Shostak
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After describing how we can search for extraterrestrial life, Seth Shostak gives some information about the SETI project and why it should find something in a not so far future.

X.T: Strategies in the Search for ET

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Seth Shostak
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is more or less the same presentation of the SETI project.

X.T: Spencer Wells: Building a family tree for all humanity
Spencer Wells: A family tree for humanity

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Spencer Wells
ARTICLE.COMMENT: By analysing DNA of humans all around the planet, Spencer Wells tries to find out how and when the humanity conquered the world.

X.T: Intelligence in Wikipedia

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Daniel S. Weld
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Applying IA to try to semantically understand the Web, first by starting with Wikipedia to bootstrap the learning.

X.T: Autonomous Vehicle Driving from Italy to China

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Erico Guizzo
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Experimenting partially autonomous vehicles across Europe and Asia.

X.T: How Hard Should It Be To Stop a Runaway Luxury Car?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Robert Charette
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Are the Toyota and Lexus crashes due to floor mats or to an incorrect electronic design? It is funny to see the comments on this article: this debate is very animated.

X.T: Why Japan's Fragmented Grid Can't Cope
X.ST: Bridging Japan's east-west frequency divide to stoke power flows will require real engineering hustle

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Peter Fairley
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Palliating the loss of Fukushima reactors is made difficult by the fact that a half of the Japan is using 50Hz while the other half is using 60Hz.

X.T: Clay Shirky: Institutions vs. collaboration
Clay Shirky: Institutions vs. collaboration

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Clay Shirky
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The very common idea that more and more projects succeed by collaboration rather than by administration. Despite the fact that nothing is new here, Clay Shirky's presentation is effective to describe this.

X.T: Candy Chang: Before I die I want to…
Candy Chang: Before I die I want to ...

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Candy Chang
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A simple idea, suggesting people to write down what they want to do before their death, but the presentation presents few ideas and is overly sentimental.

X.T: CrowdInside: Automatic Construction of Indoor Floorplans

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Moustafa Youssef
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Data mining the traces from the phone (accelerometer, magnetometer, gyroscope, and the received WiFi signals) of many persons to generate the plan of a building.

X.T: SkyLib: A Global, User-based Library for Everything

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Geir Engdahl
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The rational for creating a library of objects the neighbors can borrow, and some high level information about its implementation.

X.T: Organizing the World's Scientific Knowledge to make it Universally Accessible and Powerful

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Gully Burns
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another try to organize scientific data. The fact that he does not even speak about CDISC adds to my feeling of bullshit.

X.T: L'odyssée de l'espèce

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jacques Malaterre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The story of men: australopithecus afarensis, australopithecus anamensis, homo habilis, homo ergaster, homo erectus, neanderthal, and homo sapiens.

X.T: Why the Flash Crash Really Matters
X.ST: The debate about what caused the 2010 stock market Flash Crash is missing the point.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Chris Clearfield
James Owen Weatherall
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The 2010-05-06 flash crash was not due a company selling futures or someone trying to manipulate the market, but to the fact that the system was in an unstable state.

X.T: L'anthropologie aujourd'hui

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marc Augé
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some ideas about the current world: the world as a city, the city as a world, frontiers…

X.T: Comment triomphe une théorie scientifique ?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Vincent Jullien
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some examples of how a scientific theory has been accepted.

X.T: Les momies gelées de Verkhoïansk

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Digging in some frozen tombs to understand the history of Yakutia.

X.T: Empreinte génétique sans conscience n'est que ruine de la Justice

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Derek Muller
